content:
Key Points

  • Success Lending eXp is an exclusive mortgage platform for eXp Realty agents, streamlining home loans for clients.
  • Success Lending eXp offers competitive rates and personalized loan programs (Conventional, FHA, VA, Jumbo, etc.).
  • Seamless integration with eXp Realty’s tools accelerates closings and simplifies agent workflows.
  • Cloud-based technology enables agents to manage mortgages faster and boost credibility with clients.
  • Trusted expertise from a seasoned team ensures tailored solutions and smoother client experiences.
  • Nationwide reach across 25+ states (and growing) supports local and relocation-based transactions.

If you’ve ever wished the mortgage process was easier for your clients (and for you!), Success Lending eXp makes that happen. Created exclusively for eXp Realty agents, Success Lending offers an in-house lending platform that streamlines home financing from start to finish.

Success Lending eXp gives you an edge with personalized loan options, competitive rates, and lightning-fast communication—all designed to help you close more deals, faster. Your clients get a smooth, transparent lending experience, and you get to be their hero. Let us explain how. Here’s your handy dandy index:

What Is Success Lending eXp?

Success Lending is a game-changing mortgage platform built for eXp Realty agents and their clients. Launched in 2021 joint venture with Kind Lending, it offers a full suite of residential mortgage solutions, delivered through innovative technology and top-notch support.

This isn’t just another lender. Success Lending integrates seamlessly with the eXp Realty platform, giving agents and clients a faster, easier, and more flexible home financing experience. For eXp agents, Success Lending is just one part of eXp Solutions for agents to help their clients.

Overview of Mortgage Solutions at Success Lending eXp

Success Lending eXp offers a wide variety of loan programs designed to meet the needs of nearly any homebuyer. Their lineup includes:

  • Conventional Loans
  • VA Loans
  • FHA Loans
  • First-Time Homebuyer Programs
  • Jumbo Loans
  • …and more.

With an easy-to-use digital application process, your clients can breeze through the paperwork and stay in the loop with real-time updates. Success Lending eXp matches each client with the right loan for their needs—keeping long-term financial health in mind. It’s the kind of mortgage experience that makes YOU the hero of their homebuying journey.

Where Does Success Lending Operate?

Success Lending eXp operates in multiple states—and they’re expanding quickly! States like: Alabama, Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Iowa, Louisiana, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Nebraska, New Jersey, North Carolina, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Tennessee, Texas, West Virginia, and Wisconsin. Whether your client is buying locally or relocating across state lines, this lender has the regional expertise to navigate state-specific regulations and deliver proven mortgage solutions. They’re here to help you and your clients get to the closing table—no matter where “home” happens to be.

Leadership and Team Expertise

Success Lending eXp is powered by an all-star team of seasoned mortgage professionals. These are the folks who know how to navigate complex lending situations and make them feel easy. Their collaborative culture and commitment to ongoing training mean your clients will work with loan officers who are sharp, responsive, and genuinely invested in their success. It’s the kind of team you want in your corner.

The Power Duo: eXp Realty + Success Lending

When two powerhouses join forces, big things happen. That’s exactly what you get with the strategic partnership between eXp Realty and Success Lending. Together, they’re transforming how real estate agents support their clients—making the home-buying and financing experience smoother, faster, and less stressful.

This isn’t just about streamlining the mortgage process (although that’s a huge win). It’s about giving eXp Realty agents an edge in today’s competitive market. By teaming up with Success Lending eXp, agents can offer their clients an all-in-one solution that simplifies everything from showing the home to closing the loan.

And because both companies are built on innovation, transparency, and service, clients get a better experience at every step. This partnership isn’t just raising the bar—it’s resetting the standard for what real estate and mortgage services should be.

How the Success Lending eXp Partnership Benefits Real Estate Agents

For eXp Realty agents, working with Success Lending is like unlocking a new level of service (and opportunity!). Here’s how it helps:

  • Exclusive Access to Competitive Rates & Loan Programs: Agents can offer clients attractive mortgage rates and flexible loan options that are often only available through Success Lending eXp.
  • An Instant Credibility Boost: Partnering with a trusted, national mortgage lender builds buyer confidence—and makes you the hero of their home-buying story.
  • Tools That Make You Look Like a Pro: From loan calculators to personalized support, Success Lending equips agents with the resources they need—especially when paired with the full suite of agent tools available through eXp Realty— to attract more clients and close deals with confidence.
  • More Deals, More Earnings: Success Lending’s referral opportunities mean agents can earn additional income through successful mortgage referrals. More deals closed = more commissions in your pocket.

Whether you’re helping a first-time buyer or a seasoned investor, this partnership puts more solutions (and more value) in your hands.

Get More with eXp Realty’s Preferred Partner Program

As part of eXp Realty’s Preferred Partner Program, Success Lending eXp gives agents VIP access to even more tools and training:

  • Exclusive Digital Training & Workshops: Stay up-to-date with Success Lending’s expert-led sessions on mortgages, market trends, and best practices.
  • Marketing Support & Resources: Tap into customizable templates, co-branded materials, and joint marketing strategies—just like in these proven real estate marketing assets tailored for eXp agents—to promote your services and attract more buyers.
  • Streamlined Communication Channels: Enjoy faster, direct access to Success Lending’s loan officers and support staff—helping you get answers (and updates) quickly.

This program is designed to give eXp Realty agents everything they need to deliver a top-notch client experience and focus on what they do best: selling homes and building relationships.

Better Collaboration = Better Results for Clients (And Agents!)

When eXp Realty agents and Success Lending eXp loan officers team up, everyone wins. This partnership isn’t just about smart collaboration—it’s about elevating the entire client experience while opening up new opportunities for agents to grow their business and income.

Faster Closings

When agents and lenders work side-by-side, communication is seamless and proactive. That teamwork shaves days—sometimes even weeks—off the closing timeline. Your clients get the keys to their new homes faster, and you get more time to focus on your next deal.

Tailored Mortgage Solutions for Every Client

Success Lending loan officers collaborate directly with agents to design custom lending solutions that fit each client’s unique financial situation. Whether it’s a first-time buyer, a seasoned investor, or someone with complex financing needs, you can offer mortgage options that close the deal.

New Revenue Opportunities for Agents

Beyond better service for clients, eXp Realty agents can tap into additional income streams through the Success Lending eXp referral program. Agents who refer qualified loan officers may also qualify for bonuses—up to $10,000. It’s a smart way to boost your earnings while expanding your professional network. Success Lending’s referral opportunities mean agents can earn additional income through successful mortgage referrals—another great way to boost your income alongside eXp Realty’s commission split and revenue share model.

More Lending Choices = More Satisfied Clients

Success Lending offers a comprehensive portfolio of mortgage products, from conventional loans to VA loans and first-time buyer programs. More options mean better solutions tailored to each client’s needs, giving you a competitive advantage and building trust that leads to lifelong clients.

Premium Support and Resources to Help Agents Win

With cloud-based tools, ongoing training, and marketing resources, Success Lending eXp equips agents with everything they need to guide clients through the mortgage process confidently. Whether it’s a loan calculator or educational webinars, you’ll have the tools to stay sharp and provide unbeatable service.

Collaboration That Sparks Innovation

Success Lending creates a collaborative culture where agents and mortgage professionals share knowledge, strategies, and best practices. This teamwork leads to innovative solutions, faster problem-solving, and a better experience for both clients and agents.

Happier Clients, Stronger Relationships

A seamless mortgage process builds confidence and turns clients into loyal fans. Happy clients become repeat clients—and they’re more likely to send referrals your way.

Ready to Build Your Future with Success Lending eXp?

eXp Realty agents are turning to Success Lending eXp because it offers something traditional mortgage partnerships don’t—seamless collaboration, better client experiences, and new ways to grow your business. Whether you’re helping first-time buyers, seasoned investors, or anyone in between, Success Lending makes it easier to provide tailored lending solutions that get deals done faster and more efficiently.

And if you’re looking to take it a step further, partnering with Smart Agent Alliance can provide additional tools and resources to support your growth. Smart Agent Alliance offers:

Smart Agent Alliance gives agents access to:

  • A done-for-you real estate attraction website for passive income
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($10,500 value) for social media marketing
  • Weekly coaching sessions with top producers
  • Customizable lead funnels, email campaigns, and marketing templates
  • Step-by-step revenue share growth strategies

All free for agents who join through the Smart Agent Alliance sponsor line. When you combine that kind of value with eXp’s scalable team model, you get the kind of career growth that’s both smart and sustainable.

title: eXp Commercial Division Structure Explained
excerpt: Keep 100% commissions after $20K cap. Access CoStar tools, stock equity & global markets. Join eXp Commercial agents now.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Commercial is a cloud-based commercial real estate brokerage offering an 80/20 split with a $20,000 cap, national and global reach, advanced data tools like CoStar, and optional stock and revenue share programs for commercial real estate agents.

TL;DR About eXp Commercial at eXp Realty

  • Cloud-based commercial real estate brokerage
  • 80/20 commission split with a $20,000 annual cap
  • 100 percent commission after capping, minus transaction fees
  • Access to CoStar, Buildout, AIR CRE, and Canva Enterprise
  • Optional stock ownership and revenue share programs
  • Operates inside the broader eXp Realty divisions ecosystem

Commercial real estate operates differently than residential. Longer deal cycles, higher price points, and data-driven clients demand stronger tools and more flexibility. eXp Commercial was built to remove the overhead, geographic limits, and rigid structures that many traditional commercial brokerages still rely on.

This article explains how eXp Commercial fits into the broader eXp Realty divisions ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

What Is eXp Commercial?

More About Stock Awards for eXp Commercial Agents

Achieving ICON Status at eXp Commercial

CoStar Integration Explained: Supercharging eXp Commercial Agents

What Top Producers Are Saying About eXp Commercial
Eligibility and Licensing Requirements
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Commercial

Who is eXp Commercial best suited for?
Related eXp Realty Division Guides

What Is eXp Commercial?

eXp Commercial is the commercial real estate division of eXp Realty. It supports commercial, industrial, multifamily, land, retail, office, and business brokerage transactions. The division operates within eXp Realty’s cloud-based brokerage model, meaning agents do not work from physical offices. Brokerage services, transaction management, and internal collaboration are accessed through eXp’s virtual platform.

eXp Commercial functions under the same corporate ownership, compliance standards, and licensing framework as eXp Realty, while maintaining structures specific to commercial real estate activity.

eXp Commercial combines commercial real estate and business brokerage under one innovative platform. Whether you’re brokering investment properties or facilitating business sales, eXp Commercial equips you with everything you need to succeed wherever you are.

As one of the country’s fastest-growing commercial real estate firms, agents have access to powerful tech tools, collaborative virtual workspaces, and multiple streams of income including competitive commissions, revenue share, and stock equity.

Why eXp Commercial Was Created

After revolutionizing the residential market, eXp Realty set its sights on the commercial sector. In February 2021, eXp World Holdings officially launched eXp Commercial, bringing its cloud-based, tech-forward approach to commercial real estate agents ready for something better.

At the time, traditional commercial brokerages were stuck in outdated models, burdened by expensive office overhead, limited technology, and slow-moving processes. eXp Commercial introduced a virtual brokerage model that removed those barriers, giving commercial real estate agents more flexibility, more earning potential, and access to advanced tools that make doing business faster and smarter.

From Launch to Leadership

Since its debut, eXp Commercial has quickly become one of the most innovative commercial real estate brokerages in the industry. Built for modern commercial real estate agents, it offers a cloud-based platform designed to remove traditional barriers like office overhead and geographical limitations. Instead of being tied to a physical location, eXp Commercial agents have national and global reach, backed by advanced technology and a powerful network of real estate professionals.

What really sets eXp Commercial apart is its relentless focus on providing the tools agents need to succeed in today’s competitive market. From Buildout, which simplifies listing creation and syndication, to CoStar, delivering powerful market data and analytics, eXp Commercial gives agents the tech and flexibility to close deals faster and scale their businesses smarter.

And because it’s all virtual, commercial real estate agents can collaborate in real-time inside eXp World, connect with peers across borders, and access training and mentorship from top industry leaders, all without the costly overhead of traditional commercial real estate brokerages.

eXp Commercial Agent Costs and Compensation

Compensation structures for eXp Commercial differ from residential commission models and vary based on transaction type, market, and brokerage agreements.

Participation in eXp Commercial does not require desk fees or physical office expenses. Agents remain responsible for standard professional costs such as licensing, insurance, and any market-specific requirements.

Commission splits, caps, and fees are disclosed during onboarding and may differ from residential terms.

How Agent Splits Work

At eXp Commercial, the commission structure was designed with the commercial real estate agent in mind. It’s transparent, scalable, and rewards productivity with multiple income streams.

Agents earn an 80/20 commission split, capped at $20,000 annually. Once you reach the cap, you move to 100% commission, paying only a $250 broker review fee and a $100 E&O fee (capped at $1,000 per year) on each additional transaction.

This simple cap model means agents who produce more keep more. For example, a commercial real estate agent with $300,000 in GCI could save tens of thousands in commission splits compared to traditional commercial real estate brokerages.

Understanding Fees and Caps

Here’s what you can expect:

  • $500 monthly technology fee, covering tools like CoStar, Buildout, AIR CRE, and Canva Enterprise.
  • $250 broker review fee per closed transaction.
  • $100 E&O insurance fee per transaction, capped at $1,000 annually.
  • $20,000 annual commission cap, after which agents keep 100% of their commissions.

Benefits of the Commission Model

This isn’t just about commissions—it’s about building long-term wealth:

  • Revenue Share: Earn up to 4% Tier 1 revenue share when you attract agents to eXp Commercial.
  • Equity Opportunities: Get stock awards for production milestones and sponsorship. Plus, take advantage of the Agent Equity Program, which lets you purchase EXPI stock at a 5% discount.
  • ICON Agent Program: High performers can earn their entire $20,000 cap back in EXPI stock, creating another path to long-term wealth

These programs create multiple income streams for eXp Commercial agents, giving them opportunities to build sustainable, long-term success.

More About Stock Awards for eXp Commercial Agents

At eXp Commercial, building long-term wealth is baked into the model. Agents don’t just earn commissions—they become owners. Through eXp World Holdings’ stock award program, commercial real estate agents have an opportunity to accumulate equity as they build their businesses.

1. How the Stock Awards Program Works

Agents earn EXPI stock awards for hitting key production milestones. Close your first transaction of the year and receive $200 in EXPI stock. Reach your $20,000 cap and unlock even more equity awards. Plus, through the Agent Equity Program, you can choose to divert 5% of your commissions to purchase EXPI stock at a 5% discount, an easy way to create an automatic wealth-building strategy. All stock awards are subject to a three-year vesting period, rewarding agents who are committed to growing their business and the company long-term.

2. The Benefits of Stock Ownership

Owning stock in eXp World Holdings gives commercial real estate agents a direct stake in the company’s success. As the brokerage grows, agents benefit from stock appreciation, creating an additional wealth-building path beyond traditional commission earnings. This alignment between agent and company ensures everyone works toward mutual success.

And for agents who hit production benchmarks like $100K in GCI, the benefits multiply, providing both immediate income and long-term equity.

Achieving ICON Status at eXp Commercial

For commercial real estate agents who want to take their success to the next level, ICON Status at eXp Commercial is the ultimate recognition. Reserved for top producers, this prestigious designation rewards high achievers with major perks—plus a hefty stock award.

What Is ICON Status?

ICON Status honors commercial real estate agents who demonstrate outstanding production and leadership. It’s not just a badge of honor. It comes with serious financial benefits, including the opportunity to earn back your entire $20,000 cap in EXPI stock.

ICON Agents are also recognized company-wide and invited to exclusive networking events and leadership programs, elevating their brand and opening doors to even more high-level opportunities.

How to Qualify for ICON Status

To qualify, agents must meet a production threshold by contributing $20,000 in cap commissions within 12 months. After capping, they must close additional deals that contribute to their total production and engage in eXp’s cultural activities, like mentoring or participating in company events.

For commercial real estate agents dealing with higher-priced assets or longer sales cycles, there are flexible pathways that take into account deal size and volume to ensure ICON is within reach.

CoStar Integration Explained: Supercharging eXp Commercial Agents

In today’s fast-paced commercial real estate market, top-tier data and analytics aren’t a luxury—they’re a necessity. That’s why eXp Commercial partnered with CoStar Group, the industry leader in commercial real estate data. This powerful integration gives eXp Commercial agents a competitive advantage with instant access to the most accurate property information and deep market insights, all in one place.

Combining CoStar’s data powerhouse with eXp Commercial’s cloud-based model allows agents to make smarter decisions, close deals faster, and deliver an exceptional client experience. The best part? Other agents pay over $500/month for just this one tool! eXp agents get CoStar and more value for their $500/month fee.

1. What Is CoStar Integration?

CoStar is the leading platform for commercial real estate data, covering every property sector—office, retail, industrial, multifamily, land, and more. It offers the most comprehensive and up-to-date database in the industry.

With CoStar integrated directly into the eXp Commercial platform, agents gain:

  • Real-time access to property listings and market trends.
  • Advanced analytics for evaluating investments and opportunities.
  • Streamlined tools for researching comps, demographics, and competitive landscapes.

This integration simplifies research, shortens the decision-making process, and equips agents with actionable insights right when you need them.

2. Key Benefits for eXp Commercial Agents

The CoStar integration does more than provide data—it transforms how eXp Commercial agents work. Here’s how it makes a difference:

Data You Can Trust – Agents get access to CoStar’s industry-leading database, featuring verified, real-time property and market information. No guesswork. Just reliable insights you can act on.

Stronger Client Relationships – Backed by CoStar’s analytics, agents deliver well-informed, data-driven recommendations on site selection, leasing strategies, and investment opportunities. This builds trust and credibility with clients.

Faster, Smarter Decisions – CoStar’s tools consolidate everything in one place, from market analysis to property comparisons. This reduces research time, allowing agents to move quickly and capitalize on opportunities.

A Competitive Advantage – Access to comprehensive data, demographic reports, and traffic analysis helps agents offer customized solutions that stand out—giving them an edge over competitors still using outdated methods

3. How to Access CoStar Tools at eXp Commercial

Getting started with CoStar as an eXp Commercial agent is simple:

  1. Log in to your eXp Commercial account.
  2. Head to the CoStar portal within your dashboard.
  3. Use CoStar’s advanced search and analysis tools to explore properties, run reports, and gather market intelligence.

With intuitive navigation and seamless integration into the eXp Commercial virtual platform, agents can maximize CoStar’s features without missing a beat.

What Top Producers Are Saying About eXp Commercial

Karl Markarian, a Los Angeles-based commercial real estate advisor with over 30 years of experience and $200 million in sales volume over the past five years, made the switch to eXp Commercial. After holding leadership roles at top brokerages like John Hart Real Estate, The Agency, and Douglas Elliman, Karl saw eXp Commercial as the clear choice for his future growth.

“I joined eXp Commercial to scale my business and to benefit from revenue share and stock opportunities,” Karl shared.

Since joining, Karl has been impressed by the support from eXp’s staff and leadership, and he’s already setting ambitious goals. “Together, we’re building something monumental. Our team is aiming for $1 billion in sales volume, and with eXp’s model, I’m confident we’ll get there.”

Eligibility and Licensing Requirements

Agents operating within eXp Commercial must hold appropriate real estate licenses in the jurisdictions where they conduct business.

Licensing, supervision, and compliance requirements vary by state and by transaction type. Agents are responsible for meeting all regulatory and brokerage standards applicable to commercial real estate activity.

Eligibility for certain transaction categories may depend on experience, credentials, or broker approval.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Commercial

Who is eXp Commercial best suited for?

eXp Commercial is best suited for commercial real estate agents who want national reach, modern data and technology tools, and flexibility without relying on physical office space. It appeals to agents who prefer operating independently while still accessing centralized resources, marketing support, and a recognizable commercial brand.

How does eXp Commercial compare to traditional commercial brokerages?

Traditional commercial brokerages typically rely on physical offices, local gatekeeping, and higher overhead that affects splits. eXp Commercial replaces much of that structure with cloud-based systems, centralized technology, and shared resources, allowing agents to operate more flexibly while retaining access to national data and support.

Do commercial agents have to recruit to succeed at eXp Commercial?

No. Recruiting is optional at eXp Commercial. Many commercial agents focus entirely on transaction-based income and client relationships. Revenue share is available for agents who choose to attract other agents, but it is not required for production, platform access, or long-term success within the commercial division.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Programs like eXp Commercial are designed to support complex advisory work and longer deal cycles, but they do not operate in isolation or replace the broader eXp Realty experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Does joining eXp Commercial change commission splits?

Yes. eXp Commercial operates under a commercial-specific commission split and cap structure that differs from residential. These terms are outlined by eXp Commercial and are designed to reflect the economics of commercial transactions. The structure is standardized within the division and does not fluctuate based on sponsor choice.

Is CoStar included for all eXp Commercial agents?

Yes. CoStar access is included for eXp Commercial agents as part of the division’s monthly technology fee. This provides agents with access to commercial market data, analytics, and listing information without requiring a separate CoStar subscription purchased independently outside the brokerage.

Does eXp Commercial offer revenue share?

Yes. eXp Commercial agents are eligible to participate in eXp Realty’s revenue share program by attracting other agents to the brokerage. Participation is optional and separate from transaction income. Many commercial agents choose to focus solely on production, while others layer revenue share alongside their sales business.

Is eXp Commercial available internationally?

Yes. eXp Commercial supports national and international transactions through its virtual platform and global infrastructure. Availability may vary by country based on licensing, compliance requirements, and market presence, but the model is designed to support cross-border commercial activity where regulations allow.

Do teams operate inside eXp Commercial?

Yes. Team structures are permitted within eXp Commercial. Teams may operate under different compensation, cap, and revenue arrangements depending on configuration and size. While the platform supports teams, individual agents within teams remain subject to division rules and brokerage compliance standards.

Why join eXp Commercial instead of a traditional commercial real estate brokerage?

eXp Commercial replaces traditional office-centric models with a cloud-based platform, reducing overhead and increasing flexibility. Agents benefit from modern technology, centralized support, competitive splits, equity opportunities, and optional revenue share, without being tied to physical offices or local gatekeeping structures.

  • Dedicated teams handle onboarding, compliance, transactions, and technology

Real estate moves fast, and agent support breaks down when everything runs through one overloaded broker. eXp Realty uses a different structure, one built around full-time employees whose only job is to support agents. Instead of waiting for callbacks or navigating office politics, agents access staffed teams for contracts, onboarding, compliance, technology, and escalation.

What Makes eXp Realty Unique?

In the fast-moving world of real estate, eXp Realty stands out as one of the most innovative and agent-focused real estate brokerages in the industry. This virtual real estate brokerage has completely redefined how real estate agents get support, collaborate, and grow their businesses. With its cloud-based model, eXp Realty brings together cutting-edge technology, unmatched realtor support, and a collaborative culture that empowers agents to thrive.

1. Dedicated Broker Support (That’s Actually There When You Need It)

At eXp Realty, you’re never on your own. Every state (and province) has a dedicated team of eXp brokers who are there to provide one-on-one guidance on contracts, compliance, marketing, and more. Need a contract reviewed? They’ve got you. Have a tricky negotiation? They’ll help you navigate it. Unlike traditional real estate brokerages, eXp’s brokers are available in eXp World, providing real-time answers without the wait.

2. A Full Staff of Specialized Support Teams

Here’s where eXp Realty takes things to the next level. Beyond broker support, you’ll have direct access to teams of eXp employees dedicated to helping you succeed in every area of your business:

  • Transaction support teams keep your deals on track.
  • Onboarding specialists get new agents up and running fast.
  • Tech support is available 24/7 to troubleshoot your tools—because we all know tech issues never happen at a convenient time.
  • And the cherry on top? eXp World has a 24/7 concierge desk to answer general questions plus an AI assistant called Luna that can deliver instant, specialized guidance on real estate best practices. If you’re looking for real estate agent support that’s quick, responsive, and helpful, this is it.

The Benefits of Dedicated Support at eXp Realty

At eXp Realty, support isn’t just a bonus—it’s built into the entire experience. First, the eXp Realty Onboarding Process ensures a smooth transition for new agents. Then, dedicated brokers to an entire staff of specialized experts, eXp agents get fast answers, expert guidance, and the confidence to focus on what they do best: closing deals and serving clients. Whether you’re a brand-new agent or a seasoned top producer, eXp Realty delivers consistent, high-quality support every step of the way.

Faster Access to Expert Guidance

In this business, timing is everything. eXp Realty’s dedicated broker team is available in real-time through eXp World—no more waiting days for a callback. Whether you need help with contract clauses, compliance questions, or tricky negotiations, expert guidance is always just a click away. Agents can respond to client needs on the spot, keeping transactions smooth and building client trust.

And it’s not just brokers. eXp has a full team of support staff ready to help with tech issues, transactions, onboarding, marketing—you name it. Need something answered fast? The 24/7 concierge desk and Luna, eXp’s AI assistant, provide instant, specialized answers whenever you need them—because this job rarely sticks to a 9-to-5 schedule.

Specialized Knowledge of Complex Issues

eXp Realty knows that real estate isn’t one-size-fits-all. That’s why they offer access to specialized experts, from compliance officers to marketing pros and transaction coordinators. Whether you’re navigating complex title issues, prepping for a final walkthrough, or building luxury marketing strategies, there’s a specialist for that.

This tailored approach gives agents the freedom to handle complex deals confidently, knowing they’ve got a team of pros backing them up. The result? More productive agents, smoother closings, and happier clients.

Equal Support for Every Agent—No Matter Your Production Level

At eXp Realty, every agent gets the same level of support. Whether you’re closing five deals a year or fifty, you’ll get the same great support—and you can use our commission calculator to see how that support impacts your bottom line.

This unique model fosters a collaborative, team-first culture where agents freely share strategies and support one another. Whether you’re new to the industry or a seasoned pro, you’ll have equal access to expert mentorship, comprehensive training, and the tools you need to thrive. At eXp, everyone gets a fair shot at building a successful real estate business.

Why This Matters for Real Estate Agents

Dedicated, around-the-clock support is one of the biggest advantages eXp Realty offers. Immediate answers and experts help keep deals on track, help agents avoid costly mistakes, and deliver a better client experience. And because eXp employees and brokers are motivated by your success—not commission splits—you’ll always get honest, helpful advice.

For real estate agents serious about growing their business with less hassle and more freedom, eXp Realty’s multi-layered support system is a game-changer. It’s why so many agents are choosing eXp as the best real estate brokerage to build their careers.

Comparing Traditional Brokerages and eXp Realty Support

If you’re weighing the difference between a traditional real estate brokerage and eXp Realty, understanding the support structure is key. While both models aim to help agents grow, how they deliver that support—and who benefits from it—varies drastically.

At most traditional brokerages, agents rely on a single broker for answers, guidance, and support. That works until it doesn’t. When one person is responsible for compliance, contracts, marketing questions, and legal issues, things can bottleneck—fast. It’s also common for broker support to be focused on top producers, leaving newer or lower-production agents to figure things out on their own.

At eXp Realty, the model flips. Instead of one broker juggling everything, agents have access to a multi-expert support system. You’re backed by an entire team of specialists—state brokers, transaction coordinators, tech support, marketing advisors, and even AI-driven assistance—all working together to give you faster, more accurate answers. Every agent gets the same level of service, whether they’re closing their first deal or their hundredth.

Why eXp Realty’s Support Model Wins

At eXp, agents don’t compete for a broker’s time. Instead, you have direct access to professionals in every area of your business—whether it’s legal, compliance, marketing, tech, or transaction management. This approach fosters a collaborative, supportive environment where agents help each other and share winning strategies—because your success benefits everyone in the network. Plus, eXp’s revenue share and equity programs create additional income streams that traditional brokerages just can’t match. Want to see what that could look like for you? Check out our revenue share calculator.

If you’re looking for a brokerage that prioritizes agent support, offers scalable growth, and gives you the freedom to work the way you want, eXp Realty delivers.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Employees

Do eXp employees replace the role of a traditional office broker?

eXp employees replace the single-broker dependency model, not broker oversight itself. Is support from eXp employees available at all hours?

Many support functions operate extended or continuous hours, including Expert Care with routing services. Broker availability varies by state, but centralized staffing allows issues to be logged, escalated, and tracked without relying on one individual’s schedule or physical office hours.

Do experienced agents use eXp employee support or is it mainly for new agents?

Experienced agents regularly use eXp employee support for compliance questions, complex transactions, onboarding team members, and operational changes. The system is designed to scale with business complexity, not disappear once an agent increases production.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Support provided by eXp Realty employees is designed to guide agents through brokerage operations and compliance processes, but it does not operate independently or replace the broader eXp Realty platform.

Do all eXp agents have access to the same employee support?

Does employee support replace mentor guidance?

How do agents contact eXp employees when issues arise?

excerpt: Discover eXp Realty’s affordable Errors and Omissions Insurance for agents. Benefit from low costs and comprehensive coverage. Join today!

Key Takeaway: eXp Realty’s Errors and Omissions insurance is structured to protect agents while controlling costs. Instead of large upfront premiums or monthly payments, agents pay per transaction with a low annual cap and reduced deductible, making E&O insurance a predictable cost component within eXp Realty’s broader income structure.

TL;DR About Errors and Omissions Insurance at eXp Realty

  • Errors and Omissions insurance protects agents from legal claims and lawsuits
  • eXp Realty charges E&O per transaction, not upfront or monthly
  • E&O fees are capped annually to limit total cost
  • The deductible at eXp is significantly lower than many brokerages
  • Costs are tied to closed transactions, not time at the brokerage
  • Coverage applies equally across transactions, including dual agency
  • E&O insurance is integrated into eXp Realty’s broader income structure

Insurance costs are often overlooked when agents compare brokerages, yet Errors and Omissions coverage can quietly become one of the largest ongoing expenses in a real estate career. At many firms, agents pay large upfront premiums or monthly fees regardless of production, which directly reduces take-home income before the year even begins.

eXp Realty approaches Errors and Omissions insurance differently. Instead of charging agents in advance, eXp ties E&O costs directly to closed transactions and caps those costs annually, helping agents manage risk without creating unnecessary financial strain.

This article explains how Errors and Omissions insurance at eXp Realty fits into the broader eXp Realty income ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your index:

Why Real Estate Agents Need Errors and Omissions Insurance

When you’re working in real estate, whether you’re with a traditional brokerage or a cutting-edge virtual real estate brokerage like eXp Realty, there’s one universal truth: mistakes (or even the perception of mistakes) can be expensive. Real estate transactions often involve hundreds of thousands, if not millions of dollars. And when that kind of money is on the line, even the most honest real estate agents can find themselves facing legal claims.

That’s why errors and omissions insurance is non-negotiable. Whether it’s an unintentional oversight, a miscommunication, or a misunderstanding about a property, clients can and do file lawsuits. Sometimes it’s justified, and sometimes it’s not. Either way, E&O insurance for real estate agents is there to cover your legal defense costs, settlements, and other related expenses so you’re not risking your business or your bank account.  According to the National Association of Realtors, E&O insurance is essential for protecting agents against claims of inadequate work or negligent actions.

But it’s not just about protecting yourself. Errors and omissions insurance also shield your brokerage from the financial fallout of potential lawsuits. Brokerages and their agents are often jointly liable in claims, which is why most brokerages, including top real estate brokerages in the USA like eXp Realty, require this kind of coverage.

How Brokerages Charge for Errors and Omissions Insurance

When it comes to errors and omissions insurance, how a real estate brokerage charges you can make a huge difference in your bottom line. Some brokerages offer flexibility, while others demand hefty upfront payments—whether you’re closing deals or not. Understanding these different fee structures is key to finding the right fit for your business and protecting your cash flow.

Upfront Annual Fees (Before You Even Close a Deal)

Some real estate brokerages, including big names like Sotheby’s and Compass, charge agents an upfront annual fee for E&O insurance. And we’re not talking pocket change. In places like Marin County, CA, agents can expect to pay $2,200 or more just to get started. That’s due the day you sign up to work there before you even close your first deal. For many agents, that’s a big financial hurdle. So while these firms might have name recognition, the errors and omissions insurance cost can be steep from day one.

Monthly E&O Fees (Whether You’re Selling or Not)

Other brokerages spread out the cost with monthly E&O insurance fees. That can feel easier to manage until you realize you’re on the hook for payments whether you’re closing deals or not. Some real estate brokerages, including certain Keller Williams and Coldwell Banker offices, charge anywhere from $300 to $350 per month. That’s $3,600 or more per year just to have errors and omissions insurance in place, even if you’re not making sales.

Per-Transaction E&O Charges (What eXp Realty Offers)

Then there’s the per-transaction model used by eXp Realty. Instead of charging you upfront or every month, eXp agents only pay $60 per transaction for their errors and omissions insurance and only when they close a deal. Even better? eXp Realty caps that fee at $750 per year. Use our commission calculator to see what that could mean for your bottom line.

So, if you’re a high-producing agent, you’ll never pay more, even if you’re closing deal after deal. It’s part of why many consider eXp Realty the best real estate brokerage for new agents and seasoned pros alike especially those who want to keep their overhead low while benefiting from top-tier real estate agent tools and virtual real estate brokerage support.

Don’t Forget About Deductibles—They Matter More Than You Think

Here’s something many agents overlook when they’re comparing errors and omissions insurance: the deductible. it matters. If a client files a claim and your E&O insurance has to step in, you’re responsible for paying that deductible before your coverage kicks in.

At many traditional real estate brokerages, and especially at some 100% commission real estate brokerages, deductibles can be sky-high. We’re talking $10,000 or more! That’s a huge financial hit, and one that can catch agents completely off guard. You might save a little on monthly or transaction fees, but if something goes wrong, you’re suddenly on the hook for five figures. Ouch.

By leveraging its national scale, eXp Realty has negotiated a lower deductible structure for agents. Thanks to its massive size and negotiating power as one of the top real estate brokerages in the USA, eXp has secured much lower deductibles for its agents. At eXp, your deductible is capped at just $2,500. That’s significantly less than what you’ll find at other real estate brokerages, and it means more peace of mind for you and your bank account.

So when you’re comparing E&O insurance for real estate agents, don’t just look at the upfront fees. Take a hard look at the deductible, too. If you ever need to use your errors and omissions insurance, you’ll be glad you’re with eXp Realty, where they’ve leveraged their size to give agents better protection at a fraction of the cost.

Factors That Affect Errors and Omissions Insurance Costs for Real Estate Agents

Whether you’re at a traditional brokerage or a virtual real estate brokerage like eXp Realty, it’s important to understand what drives the cost of errors and omissions insurance. If you’re shopping for coverage or comparing brokerages, knowing what impacts your E&O insurance costs can help you make a smarter choice and keep more money in your pocket.

Here’s what every agent should know about the factors that influence E&O insurance for real estate agents:

Industry and Professional Role

Not all real estate niches carry the same level of risk—and that plays a big role in how much you’ll pay for errors and omissions insurance. For example, commercial real estate brokers tend to pay more because those transactions come with higher dollar amounts and more complex contracts, which increase the risk of legal claims. Dual agency situations also carry more exposure since you’re representing both the buyer and the seller in the same transaction. More complexity means more opportunities for misunderstandings (and lawsuits).

Good news for eXp Realty agents: unlike some real estate brokerages, eXp doesn’t charge more for E&O insurance when you act as a dual agent. This results in consistent E&O pricing regardless of whether an agent represents one or both parties in a transaction.

Business Size

The bigger the brokerage or team, the higher the potential risk and that usually means higher errors and omissions insurance costs. More agents mean more transactions, which means more chances for things to go wrong. But here’s where eXp Realty turns the tables. As one of the largest and most successful online real estate brokerages in the world, eXp uses its size to negotiate better E&O insurance rates for every agent. So instead of higher premiums, you benefit from eXp’s bulk buying power.

Deductibles

Just like with any insurance, your E&O deductible plays a major role in the cost of your policy. A higher deductible usually means lower premiums, but it’s a tradeoff. You’ll need to have that cash ready if a legal claim is made. At many real estate brokerages, deductibles can climb as high as $10,000 (or more). At eXp Realty, the deductible is capped at $2,500, thanks to eXp’s ability to leverage its agent network for better deals. Lower deductibles mean less risk for you and more peace of mind.

What Agents Also Ask About Errors and Omissions Insurance at eXp Realty

Is Errors and Omissions insurance required for real estate agents?

Yes. Errors and Omissions insurance is required by most brokerages because it protects both the agent and the brokerage from claims related to mistakes, negligence, or omissions. While state requirements vary, E&O coverage is considered a standard professional safeguard in real estate.

How does eXp Realty’s E&O insurance differ from traditional brokerages?

Traditional brokerages often charge large upfront or monthly E&O premiums regardless of production. eXp Realty uses a per-transaction model with an annual cap, meaning agents only pay when they close deals and never exceed a defined yearly cost.

Who benefits most from eXp Realty’s E&O insurance structure?

Agents who value predictable expenses and lower upfront costs benefit most. New agents avoid large initial payments, while higher-producing agents benefit from capped costs that prevent insurance expenses from increasing indefinitely as transaction volume grows.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Errors and Omissions insurance at eXp Realty is designed to manage legal risk without inflating overhead, but it does not operate in isolation or replace the broader eXp Realty income structure.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Errors and Omissions insurance for real estate agents?

Errors and Omissions insurance protects real estate agents from legal claims alleging mistakes, negligence, or failure to perform professional duties. It covers legal defense costs, settlements, and related expenses, helping protect both the agent’s business and personal finances.

How does eXp Realty charge for E&O insurance?

eXp Realty charges Errors and Omissions insurance on a per-transaction basis rather than upfront or monthly. Agents pay a fixed amount per closed deal ($60), and the total cost is capped annually (at $750), preventing insurance expenses from increasing indefinitely.

What is the E&O insurance cap at eXp Realty?

At eXp Realty, the Errors and Omissions insurance fee is capped annually at $750. Once an agent reaches the cap, no additional E&O charges apply for the remainder of the year, regardless of how many additional transactions are closed.

What is the deductible for E&O insurance at eXp Realty?

The deductible for Errors and Omissions insurance at eXp Realty is $2,500. This is significantly lower than deductibles at many traditional brokerages, where agents may be responsible for $10,000 or more before coverage applies.

Does eXp Realty charge more for E&O insurance on dual agency transactions?

No. eXp Realty does not charge additional Errors and Omissions insurance fees for dual agency transactions. The same per-transaction fee and annual cap apply regardless of how the agent represents parties in the transaction.

How does eXp Realty’s E&O insurance affect agent income?

Because E&O insurance costs at eXp Realty are tied to transactions and capped annually, agents can better predict expenses and avoid large upfront payments. This structure helps preserve take-home income compared to brokerages with uncapped or prepaid insurance costs.

title: Comparing 100 Percent Commission and eXp Realty

content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Realty is not a traditional 100% commission brokerage, but its capped commission model allows agents to earn 100% commission after reaching the annual cap. When combined with stock awards and optional income layers, many agents earn more  than they would at flat-fee 100% commission brokerages.

TL;DR About 100% Commission Brokerages vs. eXp Realty

  • 100% commission brokerages typically charge flat monthly and transaction fees with limited support
  • eXp Realty uses an 80/20 split with a defined annual cap, then pays 100% commission post-cap
  • High-producing agents can earn their cap back through ICON stock awards
  • Stock awards convert production into company ownership, not just commission income
  • Optional income layers exist, but commission remains the primary earnings source
  • Total take-home income depends on costs, production volume, and long-term structure

If you are comparing 100% commission real estate brokerages, the real question is not just how much commission you keep on paper. It is how income actually works once fees, caps, support costs, and long-term earning potential are considered. Many flat-fee 100% models look attractive upfront but shift costs and responsibility entirely onto the agent.

eXp Realty approaches income differently. While it is not marketed as a 100% commission brokerage, its capped commission structure allows agents to earn 100% commission after reaching the annual cap. For higher-producing agents, additional income layers such as stock awards can materially change total earnings to more than traditional 100% commission models.

This article explains how comparisons to 100% commission brokerages fit into the broader eXp Realty income ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Understanding 100% Commission Brokerages

What Agents Also Ask About 100% Commission Real Estate Brokerages

Is a 100% commission real estate brokerage always the most profitable option?

Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Income Guides

How eXp Realty Works: A Path to 100% and Potentially Beyond

At eXp Realty, agents start with a competitive 80/20 commission split, but there’s a cap. Once you’ve paid $16,000 to the brokerage, you keep 100% of your commission for the remainder of your anniversary year. And for high-producing agents, eXp’s ICON Agent Program offers the opportunity to earn that $16,000 cap back in company stock. Additionally, all producing eXp agents earn company stock when they hit certain milestones, like doing their first transaction each year.  That means you’re not just earning 100%; you can earn more than 100%.

And unlike most 100% commission real estate brokerages, eXp Realty gives agents cutting-edge real estate technology, an online real estate brokerage model with global reach, full-time lead generation support, and access to additional income streams through revenue share and stock awards. There’s no comparison.

Understanding 100% Commission Brokerages

At a typical 100% commission real estate brokerage, agents keep all of their commission and just pay a flat transaction fee or monthly desk fee to the brokerage. While this model sounds appealing, especially to experienced agents with an established client base, it comes with trade-offs. Agents are usually on their own to cover the costs of technology, lead generation, marketing, and training.

There’s little to no support, no additional income streams, and no opportunity to build passive income. Unlike eXp Realty’s revenue share program, which offers true time freedom, retirement income, and willable wealth, traditional 100% commission models provide no long-term wealth-building opportunities. And while eXp Realty isn’t a traditional brokerage by any means, it offers high-producing agents the ability to earn 100% (or more), along with all the support, technology, and passive income potential that standard 100% shops simply can’t match.

Evaluating the Cost-Benefit Ratio

When you’re comparing eXp Realty to a traditional 100% commission brokerage, it’s important to look beyond the commission split. Sure, those models offer simplicity, flat fees and predictable transaction costs, but they often leave agents on their own to cover tech, training, and lead generation. More importantly, they provide zero opportunity for passive income, long-term wealth, or retirement benefits.

With eXp Realty, not only can high-producing agents earn 100% commission (and beyond), but every agent gets access to world-class real estate technology, resources, and tools that the only profitable, publicly traded brokerage in the last 5 years can offer.  Now that’s stability!

If you’re weighing your options, ask yourself:

  • What’s the commission split or cap?
  • Are there flat fees or hidden costs?
  • What transaction fees will I pay?
  • Is there passive income potential (like eXp’s revenue share)?
  • What kind of support will I receive?
  • How much training is available (for new or experienced agents)?
  • Is marketing and lead generation provided?
  • Are there networking or referral opportunities (locally and globally)?
  • Does the brokerage offer additional tools, resources, and healthcare options?
  • Is the brokerage stable, innovative, and built for the future?

When you add it all up, eXp Realty offers something 100% commission brokerages simply can’t match: more support, more opportunities, and the potential to earn more than 100%.

What Agents Also Ask About 100% Commission Real Estate Brokerages

Is a 100% commission real estate brokerage always the most profitable option?

Not necessarily. While 100% commission brokerages allow agents to keep their full commission, they often require agents to pay higher monthly fees, transaction costs, and technology expenses. Profitability depends on total costs, production volume, and whether the brokerage provides tools, support, or additional income opportunities.

How does earning 100% commission at eXp Realty differ from a traditional 100% brokerage?

At eXp Realty, agents earn 100% commission only after reaching a defined annual cap, rather than paying uncapped fees indefinitely. Unlike most 100% brokerages, eXp also offers stock awards and optional revenue share, which can extend income beyond transactions without increasing commission splits.

Who typically benefits most from a 100% or capped commission model?

Agents with consistent transaction volume or plans to scale production often benefit most from capped commission models. Reaching the cap earlier in the year allows agents to retain more commission on additional closings, which can outperform flat-fee 100% brokerages depending on costs and support needs.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

eXp Realty’s approach to earning 100% commission after capping is designed to reduce long-term brokerage costs for producing agents, but it does not operate in isolation or replace the broader brokerage income structure.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is eXp Realty a 100% commission real estate brokerage?

No. eXp Realty operates on an 80/20 commission split with a $16,000 annual cap. After reaching the cap, agents earn 100 percent of their commission for the remainder of their anniversary year. High-producing agents may also earn stock awards that effectively offset brokerage costs.

How can eXp Realty agents earn more than 100 percent commission?

Agents who qualify for eXp’s ICON Agent Program can earn their entire annual cap back in company stock. In addition, agents may earn production-based stock awards and optional revenue share, allowing total compensation to exceed what would be earned through commission splits alone.

What fees do agents typically pay at eXp Realty?

eXp Realty agents pay a monthly brokerage fee and per-transaction fees that include broker review and Errors and Omissions insurance. These fees are capped annually. After reaching the cap, transaction fees are reduced, which increases net income on subsequent transactions.

How does eXp Realty compare to traditional 100% commission brokerages?

Traditional 100% commission brokerages often rely on flat monthly fees and transaction costs but provide limited technology or support. eXp Realty combines a capped commission model with brokerage-provided tools, training, and optional income programs, which can result in higher net income for producing agents.

Does eXp Realty offer passive or long-term income opportunities?

Yes. In addition to commission income, eXp Realty offers stock awards tied to production and an optional revenue share program. These income layers are separate from commission splits and are designed to supplement transaction income rather than replace active real estate production.

Is eXp Realty suitable for agents considering a 100% commission model?

eXp Realty can be a fit for agents evaluating 100% commission brokerages who also want access to brokerage-provided technology, training, and long-term income options. Whether it is the right fit depends on production goals, cost sensitivity, and interest in income beyond commissions.

This sense of connection and community is a major reason why so many agents rave about their eXp Realty reviews.

Revenue Share: Passive Income for the Future

eXp Realty’s revenue share model is hands down one of the best in the industry. As part of your real estate brokerage fee, you’ll have access to:

  • A 7-tier revenue share plan that rewards you for bringing other talented agents into eXp.
  • Optional revenue share participation that can continue after retirement and may be passed on to beneficiaries, subject to program rules and ongoing company production.
  • Sponsors teams may help you attract, onboard, and support agents without doing all the heavy lifting yourself.
  • See the income possibilities for yourself with our eXp Revenue Share Calculator.

How the $85 Real Estate Brokerage Fee Compares to Traditional Brokerages

When you compare eXp Realty’s $85 monthly real estate brokerage fee to the fees charged by traditional real estate brokerages, the fee structures differ in how costs are allocated and scaled. Most agents at brick-and-mortar brokerages end up paying a variety of extra costs that chip away at their commissions, often without realizing how much they’re spending.

Here’s a quick breakdown of common fees at traditional brokerages:

  • Franchise Fees – Typically 6-8% of every transaction, these go straight to the corporate franchisor (and they never stop).
  • Desk Fees – Agents often pay $200 to $1,000+ per month just to have a physical office space—even if they don’t use it.
  • Royalties & Transaction Fees – Some brokerages charge additional royalties on top of splits, plus admin or processing fees per transaction.
  • Office Overhead – At many traditional brokerages, agents cover shared office expenses, marketing collateral, and even office supplies.
  • Tech Subscriptions – CRM, transaction management software, and marketing tools usually aren’t included. Agents end up subscribing to third-party services (often at premium prices) to fill in the gaps.

Now, compare that to eXp Realty:
For a flat $85 per month, you get everything included: no franchise fees, no desk fees, and no royalties.

And the best part? eXp Realty’s brokerage fee doesn’t increase as you grow. Whether you’re closing a handful of deals a year or you’re a top producer hitting icon status, your monthly real estate brokerage fee stays the same. It’s predictable, affordable, and scalable, especially for high-performing agents who want to maximize their income and minimize their expenses.

At eXp Realty, your business is designed to scale without scaling up your costs. It is one of several structural differences that distinguish eXp Realty’s brokerage fee model from traditional office-based firms.

What Agents Also Ask About Real Estate Brokerage Fees

Are real estate brokerage fees negotiable at most brokerages?

At many traditional brokerages, fees vary by office, production level, or negotiation. This often leads to inconsistent costs and unclear long-term expenses. eXp Realty uses a standardized brokerage fee, providing transparency and predictability regardless of production or tenure.

How do brokerage fees affect long-term agent income?

Brokerage fees compound over time. Flat, predictable fees tend to favor agents who plan to grow production because costs do not increase proportionally with income. Uncapped or layered fees can significantly reduce net income as transaction volume increases.

Who benefits most from a flat brokerage fee model?

Agents who value scalability, remote flexibility, and cost certainty benefit most. A flat brokerage fee allows agents to forecast expenses accurately and retain more income as production increases, particularly compared to brokerages with desk fees or franchise royalties.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

eXp Realty’s brokerage fee is designed to replace traditional office-based overhead, but it does not operate in isolation or replace the broader eXp Realty income structure.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the eXp Realty brokerage fee?

The eXp Realty brokerage fee is a flat monthly cost paid by all agents to access the brokerage platform. It replaces traditional desk fees, franchise fees, and office overhead. The fee remains the same regardless of production level and is not tied to transaction volume or commission income.

Does the eXp Realty brokerage fee increase as an agent produces more?

No. The brokerage fee at eXp Realty is fixed and does not increase as production grows. Whether an agent closes a few transactions or caps annually, the monthly brokerage fee remains unchanged, allowing agents to scale production without proportional increases in overhead costs.

What does the eXp Realty brokerage fee include?

The brokerage fee includes access to core systems such as transaction management, virtual collaboration tools, live and on-demand training, compliance support, and company communication platforms. These tools are bundled into one predictable monthly cost rather than charged as separate subscriptions or office expenses.

How does eXp Realty’s brokerage fee compare to traditional brokerages?

Traditional brokerages often charge desk fees, franchise royalties, and additional technology or office fees that increase over time. eXp Realty consolidates these expenses into a flat brokerage fee, which can result in lower total overhead and more predictable income for agents with consistent production.

Is the brokerage fee separate from transaction fees at eXp Realty?

Yes. The brokerage fee is separate from transaction-based fees such as broker review and Errors and Omissions insurance. The brokerage fee covers platform access, while transaction fees apply only when deals close and are capped annually to limit total cost exposure.

Can the eXp Realty brokerage fee change in the future?

While any brokerage can adjust pricing, eXp Realty has historically emphasized fee stability. Changes, when they occur, are typically announced in advance and structured to improve agent services or platform value rather than introduce additional layers of recurring cost.

Related eXp Realty Income Guides

Real estate brokerage fees are one layer of how income is structured at eXp Realty. These related guides provide additional context on how costs and earnings work together:

  • Errors and Omissions Insurance at eXp Realty: Coverage Simplified 
  • What’s the eXp Commission Split (and Why It Works for Agents)?
  • eXp Realty Fees: Where Your Commission Doesn’t Go to Die
