title: What Is the eXp Mentor Program?
excerpt: Discover how the eXp Mentor Program helps new agents succeed. Get hands-on training, local mentorship, and guidance to close your first deals.
content:
Key Takeaway: The eXp Mentor Program is a required, short-term support structure for newer or lower-production agents, designed to ensure transaction competence and compliance during an agent’s first deals. It focuses on execution, not long-term business coaching, and operates independently from sponsorship.

TL;DR About the eXp Mentor Program

  • Required for agents with fewer than three closed transactions in the prior 12 months
  • Pairs qualifying agents with a certified, local eXp mentor
  • Mentor guidance focuses on contracts, compliance, and transaction execution
  • Applies to the first three transactions only
  • Uses a temporary 60/40 commission structure tied to the program
  • Ends once transaction and participation requirements are met

The eXp Mentor Program exists to reduce risk during an agent’s earliest transactions by providing structured, local guidance on contracts, compliance, and transaction flow. It is not optional for eligible agents and is not designed to replace broker oversight or long-term coaching. 

This article explains how the eXp Mentor Program fits into the broader eXp Realty support ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

What’s the Purpose of the eXp Mentor Program?
Who Qualifies for the eXp Mentor Program?
Key Features of the eXp Mentor Program
How the eXp Mentor Program Works

Why eXp Realty’s Mentorship Program Stands Out
How Is the Curriculum Structured?
What Will You Learn in the eXp Mentor Program?
What Are the Requirements to Complete the eXp Mentor Program?

Mentorship vs. Sponsorship at eXp Realty: What’s the Difference and Why You Need Both

What Agents Also Ask About the eXp Mentor Program

Is the eXp Mentor Program the same as coaching or business training?
Does mentor guidance replace broker or compliance support?
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Is participation in the eXp Mentor Program mandatory?
How long does the eXp Mentor Program last?
Can experienced agents opt out of the mentor program?
Does the mentor program affect revenue share eligibility?
Related eXp Realty Support Guides

What’s the Purpose of the eXp Mentor Program?

The purpose of the eXp Mentor Program is to provide structured oversight for transaction execution and compliance during an agent’s earliest production period Whether you’re learning how to navigate contracts or figuring out how to manage your first open house, your real estate mentor will be there to provide step-by-step guidance.

But it goes beyond the basics. Your eXp-certified mentor helps you develop the skills that make you a true professional—whether that’s negotiating offers, providing exceptional client service, or handling the inevitable curveballs that come with any real estate transaction. This is why many agents view the eXp mentorship program as one of the most comprehensive real estate mentoring programs available today.

By the time you complete the program, you’ll be ready to manage transactions confidently and independently.

Who Qualifies for the eXp Mentor Program?

If you’re a newly licensed agent, or you’ve had fewer than three closed transactions in the past year, you’ll be automatically enrolled in the eXp mentor program when you join eXp Realty. The idea is to make sure every new eXp agent gets the hands-on training and real-world experience they need to succeed.

For more experienced agents, there’s flexibility. If you’ve been in the business before but took some time off, eXp’s team will review your history to determine whether mentorship is necessary. It’s not a one-size-fits-all approach. It’s about making sure you get the right level of support for where you are in your career.

This thoughtful structure is another reason eXp is the most profitable real estate brokerage and a great fit for agents who want the balance of independence and mentorship.

Key Features of the eXp Mentor Program

What makes the eXp mentorship program stand out from other real estate mentoring programs? It’s the personalized approach and comprehensive support. Here’s what you can expect:

  • Local Mentorship: You’ll be paired with an eXp-certified mentor who understands your local market—someone who can give you insights on neighborhood trends, pricing strategies, and regional contract requirements.
  • Step-by-Step Guidance: From your first client consult to closing day, you’ll have a clear, structured path to follow.
  • On-Demand Resources: You’ll get access to eXp’s library of training materials and live support to reinforce what you’re learning in the field.
  • Supportive Community: No question is too small. You’ll be part of a collaborative, encouraging real estate agent community where learning and growth are always prioritized.

By the time you complete the program, you’ll not only have valuable experience under your belt—you’ll also be plugged into one of the strongest real estate mentoring networks in the industry.

How the eXp Mentor Program Works

Starting your real estate career, r restarting it after a slow year, can be overwhelming. That’s exactly why the eXp Mentor Program exists. This is one of the most structured, supportive real estate mentorship programs offered by any brokerage today, and it’s a huge reason many new agent reviews say eXp is the best real estate brokerage for new agents.

The eXp Mentor Program isn’t just about learning how to close deals. It’s about having an experienced real estate mentor in your corner, walking you through those critical first few transactions, and helping you build real confidence as you launch your career at one of the top real estate brokerages in the USA.

Here’s a breakdown of how the eXp mentorship program works and why functions as a required execution-focused program rather than optional coaching.

1. Mentor Assignments: Who You’ll Be Paired With

Once you join eXp Realty as a new or returning agent with fewer than three completed transactions in the past year, you’re automatically placed into the eXp mentor program. You won’t need to search online to find a real estate mentor. The program matches you with a certified eXp mentor who’s already been vetted and trained by the company.

These mentors are more than just experienced eXp Realty agents. They’re local experts who know your specific market inside and out. Whether you’re selling homes in San Diego, Dallas, or Atlanta, you’ll have a real estate mentor who understands the local requirements and customs, pricing trends, buyer expectations, and negotiation tactics unique to your region.

This local expertise makes eXp’s real estate mentorship program one of the most practical and hands-on in the industry.

2. What Does an eXp Mentor Do?

An eXp mentor acts as your personal guide and coach during your early days at the brokerage. Their role is to provide real estate mentoring through:

  • Transaction support
  • Guidance on contracts and offers
  • Coaching on client communication
  • Showing you how to run a successful open house or buyer consultation

Your mentor makes sure you’re learning practical, real-world skills you’ll use every day. If you’re wondering what does a real estate mentor do at eXp Realty, think of them as a bridge between classroom learning and hands-on experience..

3. Transaction Support: Step-by-Step Guidance on Your First Deals

As part of the eXp mentorship program, you’ll receive hands-on help through your first three transactions. This isn’t theory. It’s real-time coaching as you:

  • List properties
  • Write offers and purchase agreements with Skyslope
  • Navigate contracts and disclosures
  • Negotiate deals and close escrows

For many new eXp Realty agents, this support is what makes eXp an effective virtual real estate brokerage for launching a career. You’ll gain confidence because you’ll be learning by doing, with a professional watching your back and helping you avoid common mistakes.

4. The eXp Mentor Program Split: How Commissions Are Divided

While you’re part of the eXp mentor program, your first three transactions will follow a 60/40 commission split. Here’s how it breaks down:

  • 60% of your commission goes to you
  • 10% of your commission goes directly to your eXp mentor as compensation for their time and guidance.
  • 10% is allocated to the eXp mentorship program itself, covering administrative costs and additional resources.
  • The remaining 20% of your commission goes to eXp Realty, counting toward your annual $16,000 cap.

For example, if you earn a $10,000 commission on a deal:

  • $6,000 goes to you
  • $1,000 goes to your mentor
  • $1,000 goes to the program
  • $2,000 goes to eXp Realty and counts toward your cap

This eXp mentor program split ensures you’re getting high-level support when you need it most—without hidden costs or surprises.

5. Flexibility to Switch Mentors If Needed

Not every mentorship match is perfect, and eXp Realty gets that. If you feel like your mentor isn’t the best fit, you can request a change through the eXp mentor program support team.

Maybe you want to focus on a specialty niche, like luxury real estate or investment properties. Maybe you’re looking for a different coaching style. Whatever the reason, the ability to switch mentors makes this one of the most flexible and agent-centric real estate mentoring programs available.

Why eXp Realty’s Mentorship Program Stands Out

The eXp mentorship program is a key reason why so many agents say eXp is the best real estate brokerage for new agents. It combines the flexibility of an online real estate brokerage with the personal support of an in-person office—without any of the competition or politics you find in traditional real estate brokerages.

You get access to one of the top real estate brokerages’ national and global networks, cutting-edge tools, and, most importantly, a dedicated mentor who’s committed to your success.

How Is the Curriculum Structured?

The eXp mentorship program is organized into easy-to-follow, on-demand modules that help you build your skills one step at a time. No overwhelm, no confusion, and completely flexible to access when it’s best for you.

You’ll start with the basics of real estate fundamentals and then dive deeper into the strategies top agents use to close deals and grow their businesses.

Each module covers a specific topic, and they’re broken down in a way that’s manageable—perfect for fitting around your schedule. One day, you’re learning how to conduct a killer buyer consultation, and the next, you’re mastering negotiation tactics that win offers in competitive markets.

What makes this one of the best real estate mentorship programs out there? It’s a powerful blend of learning formats:

  • Pre-recorded video lessons you can watch anytime
  • Live mentoring sessions with your local eXp mentor
  • Interactive activities to reinforce what you’ve learned

It’s fun, flexible, and focused on helping you build real skills you’ll use every day.

What Will You Learn in the eXp Mentor Program?

This real estate agent coaching isn’t just about theory. It’s about giving you a toolbox full of strategies and practical knowledge. Here’s a quick overview of what’s covered in the eXp mentorship program:

  • Real Estate Fundamentals: Learn the basics of contracts, disclosures, and fair housing regulations
  • Marketing Strategies: Discover how to market yourself and your listings to attract buyers and sellers
  • Client Relationship Management: Build skills for working with buyers and sellers, handling objections, and creating referral-worthy experiences
  • Transaction Processes: Understand each step of a transaction, from listing to closing

No matter what you’re looking for, this program has you covered.

What Are the Requirements to Complete the eXp Mentor Program?

Success isn’t handed to you; it’s earned! The eXp mentor program sets clear benchmarks so you can track your progress and know when you’ve mastered each area of the business.

Transaction Completion Criteria

Mentees need to complete at least three transactions under the supervision of their eXp mentor. These transactions are your chance to put everything you’ve learned into action, with your mentor by your side to make sure you’re doing it right.

Your mentor reviews each transaction, giving you feedback and ensuring you’re following best practices. This hands-on experience is what makes eXp Realty one of the best real estate brokerages for new agents. You get real-world practice without being thrown to the wolves.

Graduation Process for Mentees

Once you’ve completed your required transactions and actively participated in the training, your mentor will give you the green light to graduate. Typically, mentees complete the program within six months, but the timeline can vary based on how quickly you close deals.

Graduating from the eXp mentor program means you’ve built a solid foundation for your business and you’re ready to fly solo (with ongoing support from your eXp agent community, of course!).

Mentorship vs. Sponsorship at eXp Realty: What’s the Difference and Why You Need Both

By now, you understand how valuable the eXp Mentor Program is for building your real estate career on a solid foundation. But there’s another powerful support system you should be tapping into at eXp Realty—your sponsorship line. Understanding the difference between mentorship vs. sponsorship at eXp is key to unlocking the full potential of this brokerage and setting yourself up for long-term success.

At eXp Realty, you’re not going it alone. The real estate mentorship program helps you master the basics, while your sponsor helps you scale and expand your business. These are two different roles, but together, they form a dynamic support system that makes eXp Realty an unbeatable choice!

The Role of an eXp Mentor

Your real estate mentor focuses on your early-stage development. As part of the eXp mentorship program, their role is to:

  • Teach you the transaction process from start to finish
  • Show you how to work with buyers and sellers confidently
  • Provide one-on-one support as you learn the ropes
  • Build your knowledge base through personalized coaching and real-world experience

Mentors are the backbone of your real estate mentoring, ensuring you gain the skills and confidence to navigate contracts, negotiations, and client relationships. This is especially important if you’re new or just getting back into the business after time away.

The Role of an eXp Sponsor

An eXp mentor and an eXp sponsor are not the same thing and they have two different, distinctive roles. While your mentor helps you master the fundamentals, if you have an active sponsor line, you may find an eXp sponsor that can be your business partner in growth. However, great sponsors are not usually local and they don’t help with your day-to-day business needs. And, remember, eXp sponsors are not required to provide any value, but a good one, like Smart Agent Alliance, goes over the top in providing value.

What Agents Also Ask About the eXp Mentor Program

Is the eXp Mentor Program the same as coaching or business training?

No. The mentor program focuses on transaction execution, compliance, and consumer protection. It is designed to guide agents through early deals, not to provide long-term business planning, lead generation strategy, or growth coaching.

Can agents request a different mentor if the match is not effective?

Yes. Agents may request a mentor change when availability, communication, or transaction support does not meet program standards. Requests are reviewed through eXp’s mentor support process to ensure continuity, consumer protection, and compliance. Changes are evaluated based on documented need, not personal preference.

Does mentor guidance replace broker or compliance support?

No. Mentors provide situational guidance on transactions and early production, but they do not have compliance or approval authority. State brokers and compliance teams retain final decision-making power on contracts, risk management, and regulatory issues. The mentor program operates alongside broker oversight, not as a substitute.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Support like the eXp Mentor Program is designed to help newer agents navigate early production and accountability, but it does not operate independently or replace the broader eXp Realty platform.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

Agents who join eXp Realty and name a Smart Agent Alliance aligned agent as sponsor gain access to organized sponsor infrastructure designed to preserve long-term optionality. This access includes done-for-you systems made available without cost or obligation.

Smart Agent Alliance is directly aligned with the Wolf Pack, one of eXp Realty’s most established sponsor organizations. Through this alignment, agents gain access to Wolf Pack training resources that are otherwise available for purchase, along with participation in the Wolf Pack community, without additional fees.

Full details are available on the Smart Agent Alliance eXp Realty sponsor page.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is participation in the eXp Mentor Program mandatory?

Yes. Agents who meet the eligibility criteria are required to complete the eXp Mentor Program before operating independently. Eligibility is based on recent transaction history and exists to ensure consumer protection, compliance, and consistent transaction execution. The only exception is for agents who join eXp as members of an approved production team.

How long does the eXp Mentor Program last?

The eXp Mentor Program lasts through an agent’s first three completed transactions. There is no fixed calendar duration. Completion timing depends entirely on how quickly those transactions close. Once the required transactions are completed and approved, the agent exits the program and transitions to the standard compensation structure.

Can experienced agents opt out of the mentor program?

Agents with sufficient recent transaction history are not enrolled in the mentor program. Eligibility is reviewed during onboarding and determined by eXp Realty based on documented production, not by agent request. Agents who exceed the transaction threshold operate independently without mentor participation.

Does the mentor program affect revenue share eligibility?

No. Participation in the eXp Mentor Program does not alter sponsorship placement or revenue share eligibility. The program only affects commission splits during the first three transactions. Once completed, the agent’s revenue share structure continues exactly as defined by their original sponsorship placement.

Why Mentoring Feels Thankless (and How eXp Rewards It)

Real Estate Agent Training at eXp Realty, Explained
